alert.note: Alert for McHenry (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 11:30AM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Bismarck ND has issued a Flood Warning for the Souris River near Bantry affecting McHenry County in North Dakota... ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Souris River near Bantry. * WHEN...From late Monday until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1435.8 feet, Right bank with heavy trees and brush subject to overflow. At 1439.7 feet, Flood waters affect farmland or wooded areas in refuge. Due to relative flatness of the area within reach of the gage a rather large area becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 1432.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Monday and continue rising to a crest of 1442.0 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 1440.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1442.1 feet on 05/22/1974. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
